intro: Xylorhiza glabriuscula var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy leaf xylorhiza, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
